content: this is dmg and we're making whips winds wimps
okay well I get acht about webs all the time so finally you're now gonna see how
it's done again we're gonna grab what we use for our clear plastic bases and this
time I'm gonna make several web templates so you can make them as big as
you like I'm just gonna make three corners and one central square template
so I'm using the red texture again since you can actually see it because being
clear plastic it's difficult to see without the red texture so I'm just
measuring 5 centimeters by 5 centimeters perpendicular and then drawing an arc to
represent curves in a corner and so that's 2 inches wide 2 inches high and a
curve and then I'm going to do 5 by 5 centimeter square which is 2 by 2 inches
and just using a little bit of boots of speed to speed it up slightly and then
just cut them out with scissors and what I do here is just cut out inside the red
texture just said it won't show up on the final piece and what I also do is
curve the edges so whether that means is the obviously these edges are going to
be sharp and I've just cleaning off the edges and make the curves nice and
straight but each edge I'll just blunt it just do a little bit of curve as you
can see here let's just so if you are playing with kids or something like that
or people who are imbibing all kinds of intoxication intoxication
the stop them poking their eyes out or you poking their eyes out in frustration
if the case may be so I'm just creating a zid 3 corner pieces and one central
piece and you can make this much bigger if you wish but you know just for the
modulus sort of size tiles you don't need to really go much bigger than this
so what I've done is I've got some white paint and I've just watered it down a
bit and applying it just in the swooshes across
most of the template believing some of the edges still unpainted and just let
that sit for a bit so that the paint beads up and then I'm just going to run
the hot glue gun from the corner out towards the edges in a fan so these are
strands from the from the web and I'm just drawing it out from the from the
corner so the paint underneath will start to make it look like the there's
more webbing than there actually is and that's why I painted it at first and
there's a lot more to it here in the with the central one and it's it again
from the corner I'm going from the middle I'm sorry from the edges to the
middle and from the corners for the corner pieces so just a strands coming
out now a good thing here is wisps having all the wisps is a good thing one
of the rare occasions when that's actually a good thing so lots of wisps
is good so now the next material we're going to need is a cotton wool ball and
you rip off bits and pieces of it and you just apply it onto it so while the
hot glue is still quite warm and you push it in with your fingers and then
stop rubbing it rubbing the rubbing the cotton wool into the the hot glue and
the paint so this gives the bulk of the web effect and it is quite useful so I'm
not doing the sort of thin strands of webs because when you see an actual web
from anything of any sort of large hunting spider it's going to be more
like a cocoon so if you have a look on my facebook page or on my website you
may find pictures where I've done alternatives involved in cocoons so
again I'm going with hot glue gun over the top now of the cotton wool
and again just going now just slightly more delicate than I was originally over
the paint and part of this is to hold the cotton wool down so that it's not
going to go everywhere and then I'm just dabbing it down with more cotton wool
which will pull more cotton wool out of the cotton wool ball and again add more
volume to this and then rub it in again with your fingers just to add more bulk
so now I'm going to go over the the cotton wool with white paint again going
from the corners to the edge so you're continuing that motif so that it looks
like all the strands are heading in the same direction so don't paint across it
just paint it straight from the corner to the to the edges and then from the
one that's the square in the middle just start from the middle and go up towards
the edges and again I'm just using boots of speed to speed this up now you could
use slightly darker material could use a gray if you wish if it's some other sort
of is not a spider but some of them may have a different color of web you may
want to add some blues in there this is really a highlighting stage so if you
wanted to do blues and that I would put the blue down first then do the hot glue
and then do the the cotton wool or the first one I'd run with the colors and
then the second and third layers I would then do with a with the white and then
it's just a matter of lifting them up I'm just using scissors to cut them out
and clean up the edges and it cut off the excess if you want you can leave
that there does look quite nice I'm just yeah I didn't really want that so but it
does look quite effective here you go just placing on a tile so there's the
webs of the corner and one in the middle so replace it with a smaller tile
obviously a little bit more effective you may want to make a lot
more if you're gonna put it over a large tile I'll have a lot of different
spiders and possibly you may wanna you have like access holes and things like
that you can use the same technique to achieve that and there's a spider for
